meanings.definition: Having a wavy or cloudy appearance.
meanings.sent1: The sky looked nebuly with its swirling clouds.
meanings.sent2: The artist painted a nebuly ocean scene with gentle waves.
meanings.sent3: The nebuly mist made the landscape seem like a dream.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were nebuly, drifting in and out like fog.
meanings.sent5: The nebuly pattern on the fabric was mesmerizing to look at.

meanings.definition: A line or border with a wavy or cloudy design.
meanings.sent1: The nebuly edge of the map represented the sea.
meanings.sent2: She traced the nebuly pattern on the ancient vase.
meanings.sent3: The nebuly border on the invitation gave it a unique touch.
meanings.sent4: The nebuly line between reality and fantasy blurred in his mind.
meanings.sent5: The nebuly border on the painting added depth to the artwork.
